question: In a 40-item quiz, 55% of the questions are history, and the rest are equally divided as literature and geometry questions. If Anna is sure to get 30% of the history questions, and three quarters of the literature and geometry questions correctly, how many points is she sure to get?
answer:
The literature and geometry questions comprises 100% - 55% = 45% of the quiz.
There are 40 questions*55/100 = <<40*55/100=22>>22 history questions.
There are a total of 40 questions*45/100 = <<40*45/100=18>>18 literature and geometry questions.
If Anna is sure to get 30% of the history questions, then this means she is sure of her 22 questions*30/100 = <<22*30/100=6>>6 points.
From the literature and geometry questions, she is sure to get three quarters of it correctly so that is 18 questions*3/4 = <<18*3/4=13>>13 points.
Thus, she is sure of getting 6 points + 13 points = <<6+13=19>>19 points in her quiz.
#### 19
